intro: Mimetes decapitatus, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a South African plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils along the coastal regions of South Africa. Mimetes decapitatus is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and is a popular ornamental plant in dry gardens.
